Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2014004543.CaseDesc: Marguerite Cardwell was last seen in Calgary, AB on Sept. 10, 1973, when she told a friend that she was planning on travelling to either Edmonton or Vancouver. Her vehicle was found near Canmore, AB on Sept. 16, 1973. Her purse and other personal belongings were found inside the vehicle.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, 2 inch screw in ankle

Case reference: 2014002857.CaseDesc: Colin Campbell was last seen March 12, 1998. Mr.Campbell was seen jumping off the Reversing Falls Bridge in Saint John, NB. His body has not been recovered.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants
Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014001967.CaseDesc: Mary Agnes Thomas was last seen on September 10, 1971 in a bush camp on the Fraser River approximately 2.4 kilometers from Quesnel, BC. Mrs. Thomas was with friends and is described as having been heavily intoxicated at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2014003548.CaseDesc: On October 4, 1996, Billy Taylor was dropped off at a treatment facility in St. Norbert. Billy departed the centre in the evening prior to being processed. There have been a few reported sightings of Billy, however no one has had any contact with him since 1996. Billy Taylor's whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Canadian flag on back

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2014004377.CaseDesc: On October 3, 2003, a family member contacted Police and reported that ROSS had been missing since the evening of October 1st. She indicated ROSS and his cousin were drinking together that night and that on their way home his cousin lost sight of ROSS in the bushes. ROSS did not return home. Numerous sightings were reported to police in the days following ROSS' disappearance however no one spoke directly to ROSS. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed. Further unconfirmed sightings were reported across Canada as well and were investigated. ROSS has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2021039122.CaseDesc: In June 1961, Robert Heard was seen for the last time walking in the forest near his farm located on Pot Hole Road in Eby Township, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Robert was experiencing a decline in his mental capacity.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014006465.CaseDesc: On January 18, 2014, Sofi Ma was seen for the last time with her father, Moses Ma, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019015016.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2019, at approximately 5:30 am, Monica Duah was seen for the last time by her friends at her work place in Toronto, Ontario. She failed to show up to work for her scheduled shifts.

Case reference: 2018063233.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1994, at approximately 10:00pm, Stanislawa ‘Mary’ Jurkiewicz last spoke with her family. It is believed that the following morning, Mary left her residence in the area of Fern Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2011002999.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Pringle is a 61 year old male who was last seen on August 28th, 2010. Mr. Pringle takes medication and when he is not on his medication he becomes agitated and aggressive and makes poor decisions. Mr. Pringle last had his medication on August 27th. All family and friends have been interviewed and no one has seen or heard from Mr. Pringle. Last Seen: walking on Great Northern Road by Second Line East on August 28th, 2010 at 2 pm.  At the time Mr. Pringle was not carrying anything with him and was alone.

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014002824.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1985, Sidney Manning was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. On July 17, 1985, Sydney departed from Cultus Lake, B.C. in his brown 1984 Oldsmobile. On August 4, 1985, his vehicle was located abandoned on a forest service road in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2005152590.CaseDesc: Helen went for a walk and did not return. At the time of her disappearance, Helen had only been in Prince George for a few weeks.

Case reference: 2014005069.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2008, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Kien Hua was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Kien had told his friend that he was going to borrow his parents' car and was leaving town for a couple of days. On March 4, 2008, his parents' vehicle was found abandoned in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014000002.CaseDesc: Dennis Bastillo was living with his family at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen near the Lions Gate Bridge between Vancouver and West Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004157.CaseDesc: When last seen Mark Krostewitz may have been planning a trip to Europe, however, relatives in Europe have not seen or heard from him.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002360.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1996, Benoit Lachance was seen for the last time in the Pointes-Aux-Trembles District in Montreal, Quebec. Benoit was a member of a motorcycle club called the "Rowdy Crew" and drove a blue Chevrolet Camaro.

Scar: Middle Back, Bullet still in the back

Case reference: 2007002499.CaseDesc: Aju Chukwudiebere Iroaga, was last seen on May 15, 2006 at 4:30 p.m. by coworkers at Domtar Rd 100, sometimes called Danny Lake Rd, in Bayfield Twp, Lake Rampike. He left his place of employment, which is a local tree planting site, on foot.

Case reference: 2014004882.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2003, at approximately 10:00 am, Feng Lin was seen for the last time after he parked his car at 295 Ossington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Shoulders, Two on the upper left

Case reference: 2014005271.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2009, Fanzheng Meng was seen for the last time at Britannia Park and Beach in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Meng and another man had been aboard an inflatable raft on the Ottawa River. The two men did not return to the shore and the deflated raft was subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014004485.CaseDesc: Pablo Guerra was reported missing by his family on May 10, 2004. He had no health issues. Pablo's jacket was located in a body of water under the Second Narrows Bridge by Vancouver City Police Marine Section the day Pablo was last seen.

Jacket: Black, North Face embroidered on left breast

Case reference: 2006004399.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1970, Eldie Martin Sylvester attended the docks at Cedar Point, Georgian Bay, Ontario to await the "scoot" to Christian Island.  Witnesses believe that he may have left on foot to walk home to Christian Island across the ice. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006023299.CaseDesc: Edward Nelson was last seen on June 21, 1987, in South Bay on Lake Nipigon. He was on a fishing boat heading southwest to go fishing and failed to return.

Case reference: 2012020137.CaseDesc: On Friday September 27, 1963, Diane Carrier went to the neighborhood park in the Old Quebec district of Quebec City, Quebec, to advise her brother to return home for dinner. Her brother came home alone and Diane has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003913.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1973, Martin MAIER, 63 years old, was last seen leaving the Prelate, SK hotel at 1:00 a.m. Mr. MAIER was driving a 1971 Chevrolet half-ton, red with white half camper box, SK license F133013.  Extensive searches have been conducted, however neither Mr. MAIER or his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Wool, Other, Siwash with a fish design

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.

Case reference: 2012020099.CaseDesc: Jack (Mike) St. Pierre was last seen on July 17, 2009, at approximately 1:00 p.m. He was on foot southbound from "the point" toward the hamlet of Wollaston Lake. Mr. St. Pierre may have been seen later taking a boat across the Bay at Wollaston Lake. Articles of clothing were located in the water near where he was last thought to have been seen.

Case reference: 2014005873.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2012, Mark Pearson left his residence in Coaticook, Quebec. Searches have led police to believe that Mr. Pearson could have possibly fallen in the Coaticook River near the intersection of Child and St. Paul East streets in Coaticook, Quebec. He was reported missing on September 7, 2012.

Sweater: Cotton, Blue, T-shirt with Puma on the front

Case reference: 2017041321.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2017, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Dennis Tuyshime was seen for the last time in Québec City, Québec.

Case reference: 2014005846.CaseDesc: André Boucher was last seen on July 16, 2012 in Montreal. Mr. Boucher was living in a rooming house and left all his belongings behind. Mr. Boucher was also known as "Popeye"

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2014005122.CaseDesc: On May 27, 2008, Phillip Morin was last seen in the Colony Street area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2006019199.CaseDesc: Marion Thiessen was reported missing by her husband in November, 1979. She has gone missing several times in the past and it has been discovered that she lived in Vancouver, British Columbia about 28 years ago.  She contacted an acquaintance in 1984, but there has been no contact with Marion Thiessen since that time.

Teeth: False, Partial dentures on both lower and upper teeth.

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.

Case reference: 2018059815.CaseDesc: Leroy Custer was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, on August 30, 2018.

Case reference: 2020036483.CaseDesc: Dorothy Cox was seen for the last time between the months of December 1942 and April 1943 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Pair of dice

Case reference: 2018043211.CaseDesc: On December 18, 1995, at approximately 8:00am, Sukhia Budhram was seen for the last time when she moved out of her son’s apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Since then, Sukhia has not had any contact with her family.

Case reference: 2018004583.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1953, Marion McDowell was seen for the last time in a parked car in lover’s lane in Scarborough, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, an unknown man opened the car door, and assaulted Marion’s date rendering him unconscious. When he regained consciousness, she was gone.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With a heart

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2006028199.CaseDesc: Barbara Sadowski and her husband lived a reclusive lifestyle on Marten Lake, in the Marten River area. She was last seen on the 23 or 24 of June 2006, walking along the beach near her home on Marten Lake.  She was recently in poor health.  She walked at a very slow pace, often using one or two canes or walking sticks.

Hair: Grey, White, Long, Often one or two braids
Teeth: Visible Missing, Poor condition, no teeth, mouth appears sunken
Glasses: Brown, Large frame, older style, thick lenses

Case reference: 2020007777.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1972, at approximately 3:30 am, Dina Kriba was last seen near 843 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006991.CaseDesc: Maxime Perreault was living alone and in an isolated area in the municipality of East Bolton and was working in the municipality of Eastman, in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. On April 28, 2014, Maxime contacted his family and friends stating that he would visit them around May 3, 2014 in Beloeil, Quebec. He never arrived. He usually travels on foot, by bike, by bus or hitchhiking with a navy blue backpack.

Case reference: 2014004744.CaseDesc: Cyril Detimmerman and a friend left Brandon, Manitoba on the Assiniboine River traveling to Treherne. Cyril was experienced at navigating along this river route, however water conditions at that time had been very high as a result of the spring flooding. The pair soon encountered strong currents and large amounts of debris on the river. In the process of trying to navigate to shore the boat capsized causing both men to enter the water. Both men were wearing life jackets. Extensive searches conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations several miles along the river all with negative results. Mr. Detimmerman was never found and is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014001558.CaseDesc: Mr. Cochrane was reported missing when his family expressed concern over his absence, as he had a history of memory loss and in the past ran into the bush and/or wandered off. An intensive land search was met with negative results. A set of footprints was found leading into the water of the river and an intensive operation involving drilling 10 holes through the ice in the area failed to turn up any evidence. The whereabouts of Mr. Cochrane remains unknown.

Teeth: 2 molars absent on upper right side
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Arm, Left arm in cast

Case reference: 2020007351.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1981, at approximately 3:00pm, Maria Cowan was last seen as she left her home with a friend to go shopping in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Fur on collar and sleeves

Case reference: 2014005579.CaseDesc: In the early hours of January 17, 1991, Darrell Watt was seen for the last time as he left the Beverly Crest Hotel tavern in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of his disappearance, Darrell was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and was a known associate of a motorcycle club.

Case reference: 2014001816.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1981, Wayne Martin was seen for the last time while he was out for a walk at the Rideau Heights Campground in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014035917.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2014, Steven Hector Gravel was reported missing from North Bay, Ontario by his mother. Family members and friends have not seen nor heard from him since December 2000.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tattoo of a baby
Right Upper Arm, Stephanie, Lucky, winnie the pooh
Right Upper Arm, Heart, wings, sword

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014002117.CaseDesc: On January 13, 1996, Michelle HARMER was reported missing by an acquaintance of the family who last spoke with her on October 31, 1995. The last contact Michelle's family had with her was in early November 1995.

Case reference: 2012000299.CaseDesc: Investigators with York Regional Police Homicide Unit are seeking assistance from the public in their investigation into the disappearance of a 45 year old woman. Cheryl Rowe was last seen by her family on December 22, 2011, just after midnight on Rathfon Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill. The investigation is still ongoing and investigators believe that Ms. Rowe may be the victim of foul play.

Tattoo: Upper Back, children's names, two wings with the words "Shane" and "Christina"

Case reference: 2015026912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2015, Kandice Singbeil was seen for the last time by her boyfriend in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014001739.CaseDesc: In March 1994, Joseph Bucar, having been laid off from Cassiar Mines years prior, had placed his furniture and effects in storage, accumulated credit card debt and disappeared from Kelowna BC.

Case reference: 2014005111.CaseDesc: Chad Eirikson was reported missing by his mother. He left Vancouver, Canada to tour Central America in December, 1999.  In January, 2000, he called home requesting money a few times and received wire transfers from his mother to continue his trip. He has not been heard from since January 9, 2000.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2013000134.CaseDesc: Loretta (Lora) Ann Frank was last seen in Yukon Territory between late 1988 and early 1989. She was known to reside in Watson Lake and Whitehorse, Yukon as well as Lower Post, British Columbia. Loretta was reported missing in 1993. Loretta is known to have a history of mental health concerns.

Case reference: 2008005099.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1976, Robert McDonald’s employer advised that he had not shown up for work and had not been seen since January 16, 1976. On January 28, 1976 it was reported that Mr. McDonald was seen hitchhiking south out of Ear Falls on Highway 105. Mr. McDonald has not been seen since. He was 33 years old at the time of his disappearance and was last seen at Griffith Mines, north of Ear Falls, ON.

Jacket: Blue, White, skidoo with white stripes

Case reference: 2020011793.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1985, Ruth Koenig was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ruth had taken some time off from working following the death of her husband on October 18, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014004591.CaseDesc: In July 2004, Philip Leishman left his residence with a friend from Kakisa Lake, Northwest Territories. Philip had told his family that he would be travelling to Fort McMurray, Alberta, and it was confirmed that he was in Fort McMurray until late August of 2004. Philip has ties to Port Alberni, British Columbia, Grand Prairie, Alberta, and Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2014004359.CaseDesc: On July 20, 2003, Stephane Gallant was last seen at the Shoreline Hotel in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Stephane speaks French and English with a French accent.  Stephane worked in the logging industry as a woodcutter. On July 23, 2003, his vehicle, a 1984 GMC S10 blue pickup with a black topper, was located at the Trowbridge Falls campsite on Copenhagen Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006017799.CaseDesc: Véronique Courchesne was last seen at her residence November 11, 1979. She was depressed due to a recent medical diagnosis. She had withdrawn money from her bank account prior to going missing. On December 31, 1979 she contacted her husband by telephone but has not been heard from since.

Amputation: Right Chest, Mastectomy to the right breast

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2006011799.CaseDesc: Thomas Lyon was last seen in the area of Iron Bridge, Pelican Lake, Sioux Lookout on June 28, 1998 by two acquaintances.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.
Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.

Case reference: 2014004807.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1988, Ronald Gerard Cole went missing. He has not been heard from by family or friends since then. He was a resident of Warren, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014005513.CaseDesc: Jayson Nakas was reported missing on June 30, 1995 to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Mr. Nakas fell off an inner tube on the North Saskatchewan River. Mr. Nakas' friends saw him go under water but did not see him come back up.  His friends were the last ones to see him that day.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2014004453.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2004, Samuel Samuelson was seen for the last time while driving a snowmobile by the lake on Bizard Island toward Deux Montagnes in Montreal, Quebec. The ice collapsed and Samuel and his snowmobile fell into the water.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with razor blade pendant
Gold, Bracelet worn on right wrist
